website_summaries.verdict: Quality, feature-packed kit offering superb value.

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware - Problem buying Aoyue Spare parts
customer_reviews.text: I can't get a spare B016 replacement soldering iron anywhere for the 9378 station. Aoyue doesn't allow USA residents to order parts from them directly and I've had an order placed with Aoyue's only USA authorized distributor "SRA Soldering Products in Walpole MA" since October 2016 and SRA can't get them from Aoyue. SRA was also back ordered on the B016 ceramic heating element I ordered and it took Aoyue 8 weeks to ship enough elements for SRA to fill my order. I don't recommend the Aoyue 9378 based on my experience not being able to buy spare parts. I won't recommend any company that doesn't support their customer base or their one USA based distributor.
customer_reviews.author: frank18944

customer_reviews.title: Poor finish
customer_reviews.text: First impressions are mixed. Heats up quickly, nice assortment of tips and seems to be a good value. The bad: the finish is extremely shoddy. I've included a pic of the wand holder...I have no idea what's going with that other than bad casting or something, but if this is what they allow through on the visible stuff, I wonder if there are issues inside with the electronics.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Very good value for the money for hobby use
customer_reviews.text: Quick heat up time, but I suggest giving it a minute after it says it is ready before using it depending upon the tip you're using at the moment. I find the presents very handy as I use one as my operating preset, and the other as my standby preset if I won't be using it for a couple of minutes. I sometimes wish the cable to the iron was slightly longer - maybe 8 inches. It gets regular use on my bench for my electronics and ham radio hobbies.
customer_reviews.author: Walt

customer_reviews.title: Very nice soldering iron
customer_reviews.text: This unit heats up very quickly and applies heat exactly where needed. The tip seems to stay nice and tinned. The digital readout is well-designed and easy to read. The holder is convenient and sturdy. The only downside I found that was when trying to solder thicker wire, say 12 gauge, it does not provide quite enough heat. It looks to be a soldering iron for 14 gauge wire and smaller. My old soldering gun (Weller, I think), when it works, easily supplies enough heat for 12 gauge wire, but it is not nearly as precise as this unit. I would certainly recommend this product for 14, 16, 18 or smaller gauge wire soldering.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wells

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic unit regardless of price - Fantastic Value
customer_reviews.text: Now that I have used this on a few occasions, I can affirm that it is of high quality. The unit heats very quickly, maintains heat very evenly, and has plenty of temperature range. Bonus points for being able to switch over to C or F temperature scales - saves time doing the conversion. Also - the wide variety of included tips came as a great benefit from someone just getting underway with soldering more than the occasional wire (mainly Pinball/PCB repair) My only knock would be that the quick set temperature values aren't as intuitive or easy to use as one would hope, but again this is minor and should in no way detract anyone from buying this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Hovy

customer_reviews.title: Good kit.
customer_reviews.text: Heats up in less than 10s. so glad i bough this over an analog model. Construction seems high quality. put a few hours of soldering in right away and worked flawlessly. The only concern is if it will stand the test of time, but honestly for the price/value, I am 100% happy with my purchase. other name brand products are susceptable to the same MFG flaws and Aoyue, and this is a well designed, easy to use product. My only complaint is the F for Farenheit is upside down on the display. Oh well.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel S. Neitzke

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent but I prefer my WESD51.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty nice station. I have been using a Weller WESD51 for almost 7 years now. To be honest that's still what I use 99% of the time. My cons: I don't like the iron/pencil (whatever you want to call it). It doesn't feel as thin as it could be. The wire isn't as flexible as I would like. The iron holder isn't the best but isn't the worst. It's a pretty good value but I would buy another Weller if I were forced to use this. If I could find a better feeling iron with a more flexible cord it would get a lot more use.
customer_reviews.author: justchil

customer_reviews.title: Frustratingly Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Got an Aoyue 9378 (not Pro) about 5yrs ago. It's great when it works, but far too often it won't. When new, it would work fine for about 1hr. Then the tip temp would drop and soldering was impossible. Tracked this down to an internal heat issue. Removing the cover and adding an external fan solved the problem ... for a while. Now the the tip never gets up to temp even though the Aoyue reports no errors. (Note: over 5yrs my Aoyue has only been on about 30hrs.)
customer_reviews.author: MH Jim

customer_reviews.title: This is an amazing value.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using a crummy iron for the past 20 years. Since I don't do a *lot* of soldering I just did my best. Finally, the tip broke and gave me an excuse to find something better. I wish I had this for the past 20 years! I am so happy to be able to select the perfect amount of heat. Also, unlike my previous iron that took 10 minutes to come to temperature, this iron is ready in about 10 seconds! Everything about this makes me happy, including the price. (When I think soldering I think Weller, but the prices of those are what kept me using my junk iron for 20 years).
customer_reviews.author: D. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great reliable iron, backed by a great company
customer_reviews.text: The first one I got was DOA, I immediately got a replacement from amazon of course without hassle. Also I did contact the company first just to be sure it wasn't something simple, they offered to send me a replacement or parts if I wanted to fix it (which was really cool of them and a nice thing to offer for a hobbyist). I was in a hurry so I just went the amazon swap route and the replacement iron has worked flawlessly for several months (no issues and continues working fine). I'd highly recommend this iron, in the off chance you have an issue the company stands behind their products and will take care of you.
customer_reviews.author: TheYoshi

customer_reviews.title: I kick myself for not having used something like this until now
customer_reviews.text: After many years (over 50) of getting by with cheap soldering irons, I kick myself for not having used something like this until now. I have had only this soldering station, so I cannot compare it to others. But suffice it to say that it works great! It heats up quickly, maintains temperature, and the tips last forever. The station included extra bits (worth some $$) but so far I have not had to change the original, and have done about 1000 solder joints, on PCB's and wire to wire so far. Yes, get one!
customer_reviews.author: Ingeniero1

customer_reviews.title: Great Soldering station but what is the pen with wires for?
customer_reviews.text: Got this several weeks ago and have really enjoyed it. I use it on the wiring on my RC helicopters. This has made soldering LED's especially surface mounted LED's a lot easier. Usage is straight forward with a programmable cutoff timer and two user programmable heat settings. Heats up super fast. The only this I have yet to figure out is what is the small stick with 4 wires used for. I find no mention of it in the manual or anywhere else. There must be a use or it would not be included. It may even make some of the jobs easier.
customer_reviews.author: T. M. Burns

customer_reviews.title: Excellent temperature regulation
customer_reviews.text: This iron heats up to the set temperature in just a few seconds and then holds the temperature very well. It comes with a good assortment of tips. I purchased this iron to use for plastic welding on the front and rear racks of my ATV and it worked perfectly. The adjustable temperature allowed me to experiment until I found the ideal setting to repair the cracks and breaks in the plastic. I have not yet used it for actual soldering, but compared to previous soldering stations I have used it appears to be about the best quality I have seen.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Hot Stuff (Hehe)
customer_reviews.text: I got this to solder together a circuit board kit and it works a treat. I fiddled with the adjustable temperature until I got it just where I liked it to melt the solder quickly without overheating the component being soldered. The holder can be placed wherever it's convenient at that moment and barely gets warm. The cord could be a bit longer maybe but it would probably get in the way at other times so that's a wash. Overall, this works well and is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Titan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent soldering station for the price! Can't be beat at this price!
customer_reviews.text: Great professional-class soldering iron! Easily competes with the big names like Hakko and Weller for less money! auto shut off worksexcellent as well as everything else about this iron! Turned me from a mediocre solderer into almost a pro overnight! Night and day compared to Cheaper no-name options!
customer_reviews.author: jymmiphreak

customer_reviews.title: Excellent step-up iron
customer_reviews.text: The control unit is kind of big, and the cord from it to the soldering iron is about 2 feet shorter than I would like. But wow, it does do the job for the small components that I work with. Temp is adjustable if you want to do that, and it has a shut-down timer which is nice. The many included extra tips are great. A good investment if you find yourself soldering up a bunch of little stuff like I do. You could get something $20 cheaper but this one is quality.
customer_reviews.author: Unumnunum

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to fix my salt water generator computer board. I'll grant you I might have gone overboard, but this worked great. I have never soldered before and using this was a piece of cake. I was able to desolder a current limiter and put a new one with no issues. I did think it was broken at first because it wouldn't turn on. Eventually I figured out that the tip was not seated tight enough and after tightening it, it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Hot stuff
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace a pawn shop purchased Radio Shack unit that I really enjoyed using until it went nuts. I love the fact that I retains the last settings used, because I most always use the same settings. I heats very quickly and displays first the dialed in setting at tun on, then switches automatically to the ambient heat setting after a moment. Hand free settings make work faster. Great stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought this one
customer_reviews.text: I love this soldering station. It works great. It is easy to set up and use. There a lot of nice features that make this station a pleasure to use. I looked at a lot of soldering irons before deciding. This was the right choice.
customer_reviews.author: Jazz Cat

customer_reviews.title: Decent Product
customer_reviews.text: I burn through two or three of these stations a year. I have never tried Aoyue brand products before, and so far I am pleased with this purchase. The element heats up quickly and the multitude of tips that came with the purchase have all come in handy. It doesn't feel cheaply made and the fact that it comes with an extra heating element is a plus. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: TPJR

customer_reviews.title: Amazing. Can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.text: The best soldering iron system I have used in 40 years. Kicking myself for waiting so long. I tend to dial this to 386'C and use Kester 44. That combo works well. In addition, de-soldering most modern electronics was also a snap. So far I have been using this to restore vintage turntables (Technics, etc) and modern day quad-copters.
customer_reviews.author: CBHouse

customer_reviews.title: A quality tool worth the investment
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy this soldering iron. I have used cheaper irons in the past and I grew tired of their limitations. This iron heats up fast and maintains temperature well. It appears to be well made. Minimal assembly is required.The digital display is very convenient and so is the assortment of included tips. I mostly use this product for automotive wiring projects but I have no doubt it would work great for other purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Tony T1K

customer_reviews.title: Great quality soldering iron.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a solidly built soldering iron. Displays tip temperature so you don't have to guess when the iron is ready. Sleep function means you don't have to worry as much about leaving it on (I set it to sleep after 30 minutes). Heats up faster than any other Iron I've used. Including an assortment of tips is a nice touch. The only thing I would change about it is to make the cord 4" longer.
customer_reviews.author: A. Davison

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for any hobbiest
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. This is my first digital, programmable solder iron, and it makes me wish I got this a long time ago. Anyway, the device itself works fantastic, however, I am unable to compare this model to any other (this being my first programmable digital soldering iron). If you are just an everyday tinker-er this unit works great.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome soldering station!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome soldering station! Extremely quick to reach temperature, almost no waiting time. Whether you are doing fine pcb work or soldering heavy wiring, this station lets you set the appropriate temperature easily. I'm very happy with this station!
customer_reviews.author: Dana Gandy

customer_reviews.title: And the extra tips and heat lead are amazing add-ons that cost an arm and a leg from ...
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what they say it will do. No problems. And the extra tips and heat lead are amazing add-ons that cost an arm and a leg from other vendors. Edited 12/23/2014 The more I use this station the more I like it. Really great bang for the buck. VERY fast heating, great temperature control, all around nice bit of kit.
customer_reviews.author: T. O.

customer_reviews.title: Second soldering iron and I love it!
customer_reviews.text: Got the cheap $20 soldering iron from Amazon. Worked great for 4 months to learn on then died. Upgraded to this unit and it is amazing. Heated up and ready in less then 1 minute. I have it on the bench, ready to go for a quick solder. Using this to build circit board kits for my Holiday Light Show, and for connecting RGB's.
customer_reviews.author: relxerd

customer_reviews.title: Great Soldering Gun
customer_reviews.text: This is a top notch soldering gun. I've had some real duds over the years. This one comes up to temp in a matter of seconds and heats your material equally as impressive to prep it for a good solder. I've got to say I'm glad I put the money out for this jewel and given all that was included I think it was a pretty good deal.
customer_reviews.author: 2 Tone Tommy

customer_reviews.title: very nice
customer_reviews.text: Coming from using the old plug and wait style pen soldering irons this thing is awesome. Quick heating solid construction. I haven't used any of the really expensive models but as a home hobbyist I don't see why this can't get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: amanda davis

customer_reviews.title: Great Iron
customer_reviews.text: ive had it for 6 months now, 100x better than a normal 20$ Soldering Iron. Although one downfall is the Iron cord is too short, For a small bench the cord is plenty long, but if you plan on using this on a car you will wish you bought an iron with a longer cord(like me). still a great iron
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Best iron
customer_reviews.text: By far the best iron iver ever used. Heats up really quick and holds heat to the tip very nicely
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Gary

customer_reviews.title: Nice shinny connections
customer_reviews.text: Does what is supposed to do without any hassles. Fast warm up, set it and forget it for electric guitar and amplifier work. Simply set the temperature to the solder melting point and solder on. Nice shinny connections.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Great for my needs
customer_reviews.text: This product has performed very well for my needs. I am only an occasional user.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Squire

customer_reviews.title: Great Home Hobbyist Soildering Station
customer_reviews.text: Just got my Aoyue soldering station. It came in two days from Amazon and was very well packaged. I am very pleased with it quality. I am not sure that it is really built to stand up to industrial use, but for a home hobbyist it is great. I would recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: christi

customer_reviews.title: What a great tool
customer_reviews.text: Precision performance, accurate, and complete. It's a joy to use. Its easy to deliver like a pro when you have their tools! If this is your first soldering iron, it will probably be your last. It replaced my Weller system with no regrets. I love the 10 tips that come with it.
customer_reviews.author: Merciless

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Easy to Use...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product and fairly easy to use, I am a novice at soldering and plan on doing more in the future, this set up is much better then the regular cheap pencils. It gives you a great amount of control. This merchant was also very good, I received the item much sooner than expected. Thank You... ~R~
customer_reviews.author: Robbo

customer_reviews.title: best value for the price
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality, best value for the price. I've been soldering for over a decade and this is the best unit I've ever used. The tip selection means I can access the smallest of SMD points and attack the largest battery terminals with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: No heat from this bad boy!
customer_reviews.text: Returned it. Dead on arrival or something. Item would not come on and would show just dashes, then showed some kind of error. I guess thats what you get when you buy stuff from other countries. I took it out package but felt like it had been opened because everything was all over the place in the package (Item Box) not organized. Anyways, the point is it didn't work! It looked great but I will just stick to a good old fashion little soldering iron. I would have looked great on my bench.
customer_reviews.author: The Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Sturdily build unit with a big digital temperature display. Heats up very quickly and I use it primarily for stippling of thermoplastic materials and the occasional soldering job. Much better than your standard Radio Shack unit and I would recommend this to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: HHM, PAhrump, NV

customer_reviews.title: Constant controlled temperature. not just a hot stick
customer_reviews.text: Used for about a month now.....Great tool. Never had a soldering station before so I can't compare that experience. Two features I enjoy the most. 1.) Quick heating. Ready to use in less than a minute. 2.) The constant controlled temperature. not just a hot stick.
customer_reviews.author: Grumpy

customer_reviews.title: Nice, seems like good quality!
customer_reviews.text: I've used a lot of stations over the years, and for the dollar investment, these seemed like a good deal. So far, it set up easily. The manual's language, typical of chinese-english translation, is a bit lacking, but thanks to good diagrams, can be puzzled out.
customer_reviews.author: Soluna Hedonistek

customer_reviews.title: Great product would recommend it to you!
customer_reviews.text: this product deserves 5 stars its of high quality and works well if you like bang for your buck here it is. The added tips are a bonus and I recommend the brass sponge for tip cleaning as the one provided is comically flat like it got steam rolled over.
customer_reviews.author: John L.

customer_reviews.title: best solder station
customer_reviews.text: Get solder station. This heats up very fast and I have had 0 problems. Has a good quality feel to it. I do wish it had a better sponge but thats a easy replacement, it can melt anything that I have tried. Great for RC car wiring and computer wiring.
customer_reviews.author: Grant

customer_reviews.title: buy the hakko. i sent this back and got ...
customer_reviews.text: buy the hakko.i sent this back and got the hakko.a few more bucks but night day difference.[I fell for the included tip assortment]
customer_reviews.author: MAC

customer_reviews.title: 9378 soldering station
customer_reviews.text: this is one awesome unit. I like everything about the station..the quick heat up, the digital read out, and all the different degree settings. Very easy to use awesome station....If you need a new station I would recommend this station.
customer_reviews.author: orville stamereilers

customer_reviews.title: Nice soldering station
customer_reviews.text: Got the Aoyue 9378 to replace an old Weller WPCT that had worked well for many years. The Aoyue seems to be a great replacement - works well, heats up quickly, and is well made. Great purchase at a good price. Extra tips are a bonus
customer_reviews.author: Bick

customer_reviews.title: This is a very nice Iron. When the time comes that I need ...
customer_reviews.text: I solder nearly every day, this was a gift for my dad. I get the pleasure of using it whenever I am home helping him. This is a very nice Iron. When the time comes that I need an iron at home I will be purchasing this one again.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur

customer_reviews.title: Great soldering iron. Great price.
customer_reviews.text: Nice set. Good price. Aoyue has proven to be a good brand for soldering iron despite the horrible font they use in their logo. Biggest complain is that the rubber feet for the iron stand keep falling off.
customer_reviews.author: Philly Buster

customer_reviews.title: This thing is fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: For a LOT less than the big names. Heats fast, holds heat even when soldering heavy connections. Very happy. Don't be fooled by the price, this is good. Temp seems accurate too. At least it's close enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: HandymanJD

customer_reviews.title: Shipped with Damaged Heating Element
customer_reviews.text: Unboxed, set up, turned on for the first time. Got an error saying that heating element was damaged and needed to be replaced. It ships with a spare heating element, but you need a soldering iron to de-solder the damaged heating element and install the spare one. Luckily, I have a spare soldering iron, but some people might not. Not happy that I'm having to repair the unit before I even get to use it once.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This little gem is a good buy.
customer_reviews.text: Worked as well as the other reviewers had indicated it would. I think this thing is designed for production work. I just had a small repair job but it made it fast and easy for me. I would recommend this ....
customer_reviews.author: Instructor A.

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This is my first good soldering iron and it is leaps and bounds above any other soldering iron I have ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Mike

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: One of my best investments this year. I didn't honestly think that there was much of a difference in soldering irons. I'm now aware that there is a BIG difference between irons. This unit has proven to be reliable, quick to heat, and consitant. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Graham

customer_reviews.title: has worked fantastic with the custom electronics for my home automation systems
customer_reviews.text: Quick to heat up, holds temp properly, has worked fantastic with the custom electronics for my home automation systems.
customer_reviews.author: J. Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: Having control over the temperature is a great feature for the type of soldering I need to do sometimes. The tip heats up super fast and the unit performs as advertised. Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Perceptual

customer_reviews.title: Versatile Soldering Station
customer_reviews.text: Great Soldering station with many tips. The programmable temperature feature is handy to select just the amount of heat necessary to solder but protect the components you are soldering. It is a well built unit and comes with a replacement heating element.
customer_reviews.author: Richard W.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value.
customer_reviews.text: The soldering station works perfectly. My soldering protects are much more enjoyable now. I highly recommend this product. I was not paid for my review. This is truly a great value.
customer_reviews.author: M. Grant

customer_reviews.title: 0 - 610 F in roughly 20 seconds
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine! it's fast, maintains it's temperature and comes with an assortment of tips. while I'm not a fan of the over sleeve style tip, these do work well...just have to wait for them to cool down before changing.
customer_reviews.author: M Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Two successful audio DIY projects.
customer_reviews.text: Very good soldering iron. The choice of tips is very useful. I change them to solder different components differently according to their mass and conductivity. The additional spool holder and sponge holder come in very handy.
customer_reviews.author: Brewer's wife

customer_reviews.title: Aoyue 9378 60 watts soldering station
customer_reviews.text: this is awesome soldering station..I'm very please with this one..it is very easy to set up and the heat go quickly..ready to go with the job..before I bought a cheap one. every time I want to do my job.I have to fight with it but not complished the job ..Aoyue 9378-60 watts..is the one if you want do the job fast..I like this baby and I'll recomments it to every one..thanks ..phu lai
customer_reviews.author: Phu V. Lai

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Soldering Equipment
customer_reviews.text: This unit is awesome. It hits the temperature very quickly. Solder jobs are a breeze. It also comes with a variety of tips and an extra heating element. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jerrod Pitts

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BUY!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with the quality of this item. After receiving it and inspecting it, I would honestly expected to have paid more than what I did. Great item.
customer_reviews.author: Herb

customer_reviews.title: Not working anymore
customer_reviews.text: Was good while it lasted. Not even a year old. Now it crapped out. Stopped working as of yesterday
customer_reviews.author: Patrick O.

customer_reviews.title: best low cost station i have ever had
customer_reviews.text: this thing makes every thing easy from light work with 603 leds to 10ga battery cables on my R/C cars. got over 400 hours on it so far if only it had a brother full of hot air...... ah found him
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Rafferty

customer_reviews.title: Great Desoldering Station Excellent Seller
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good Soldering station I have a commercial business repairing radios and these irons preform the same if not better than stations I've had costing 4 times the money . A good reliable product the tips and supplies are available from this seller priced well . Great service fast shipping
customer_reviews.author: Wendell Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and its a beefcake! I have only had to solder 1 thing so I haven't really used it a bunch but that one job I did it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Zachary S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Soldering Station.
customer_reviews.text: I have bought several soldering stations and must admit that after spending several hundred dollars on those units, I should have purchased this unit and saved myself the headaches and money. Heats from 0 to Max in 15 or 20 seconds, unbelievable.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Houk

customer_reviews.title: Great Soldering Station
customer_reviews.text: I got this to work on RC quads and small electronic projects around the house. I am not experienced at soldering but this was easy to use. It makes soldering so much easier than using the cheap irons without temperature control.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander G. Leonard

customer_reviews.title: It works very well like others have posted I would say the quality is ...
customer_reviews.text: It works very well like others have posted I would say the quality is just so so. My screen arrived nearly detached but for the money it performs very well.
customer_reviews.author: rough68fish

customer_reviews.title: Best soldering station I have ever used at a very affordable price.
customer_reviews.text: I am loving this soldering station. So far, it is flawless in my book. It heats up VERY quickly and displays real time tip temperature on the display. Comes with a good mix of 10 replaceable tips. Has a comfortable grip and solders well.
customer_reviews.author: James King

customer_reviews.title: Hit or miss. Hopefully you get a good one
customer_reviews.text: the first one i ordered didn't display the correct temperature, they sent a replacement and the plastic display panel wasn't glued in place, they sent another one and the same problem with the display panel. I have friends who own this unit and it works great so it seems they make one good unit for every five they build.
customer_reviews.author: Simon Marti

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: this thing rocks .. lots of use so far and I love it .. high quality does exactly what its supposed to do and a real asset to my bench
customer_reviews.author: John Dodd

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: This is the best thing I have done to improve my solder repairs. Wish I had known how much this would improve my capabilities.
customer_reviews.author: Don Plankey

customer_reviews.title: Best soldering Iron I have owned and used
customer_reviews.text: Best soldering Iron I have owned and used. It heats fast came with many tips for different jobs. I love the ability to fine tune the temperature. Highly recommend to anyone as a beginner or intermediate user.
customer_reviews.author: Joe S.

customer_reviews.title: The Biz
customer_reviews.text: tried lots of cheaper soldering irons. didn't want to spend a billion dollars on some fancy soldering station. decided to try this and i'm glad i did. this thing is fantastic. well worth the money. great quality.
customer_reviews.author: marklar

customer_reviews.title: Fair price for a very fine tool. You wont burn your tin
customer_reviews.text: Fair price for a very fine tool. You wont burn your tin, or damage components once you get the hang of the settings
customer_reviews.author: swani2002

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My son needed this for college, it`s just what he needed.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Fricks

customer_reviews.title: great product for the money, you can add on tweezers for SMD work,
customer_reviews.text: love it, tinkering with electronics and amateur "ham" radio for over 25 years. I added a soldering tip holder, and brass tip cleaner to this setup. Wish they made a hot air gun that could be swapped out for the iron.
customer_reviews.author: N8MNI

customer_reviews.title: Happy. Highly adjustable.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent soldering station. Highly adjustable for all soldering applications. Very happy with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: RLancaster

customer_reviews.title: Great soldering station.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. It heats up fast and comes with various tips and replacement parts. A++
customer_reviews.author: Burn-E

customer_reviews.title: I love this  thing
customer_reviews.text: I love to solder and this is a great solderer. You need to get this, it does everything and for the money its a good deal
customer_reviews.author: kevin Patton

customer_reviews.title: The product is not satisfied me, sometimes adjusting errors
customer_reviews.text: The product is not satisfied me, sometimes adjusting errors, or to a certain extent after all digital welding units without welding Taiwan manual adjustment is good!!
customer_reviews.author: desheng kan

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, inexpensive soldering station. A HUGE improvement over a simple soldering iron !
customer_reviews.author: OW in Reno

customer_reviews.title: Heats up very quickly, would buy again. Doesn't include solder.
customer_reviews.text: I only use this every few weeks, but so far, this iron works perfectly. It gets to full temp in just seconds, and the tips that came with are top notch. As of right now, if I ever need a second iron, I'll go for the same one. Note, however, that it does not include solder as pictured in the photo. Although I didn't expect it, they lost 1 star for including it in the photo but not disclosing in the description that it does not include solder. The product gets 5 stars, but this listing lost them a star.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I'll never go back to the cheap soldering irons again. This iron makes the job easier and professional.
customer_reviews.author: syncopath

customer_reviews.title: Great soldering iron.
customer_reviews.text: Very good soldering station for the price. Comes with a variety of tips, spool holder, and a spare element incase the original goes out or breaks.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan M.

customer_reviews.title: Good Soldering Station
customer_reviews.text: This is good soldering station for the money. Heats up very quickly and maintaines temperature well. Extra tips with different shapes are a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love this iron. That is all that need be said
customer_reviews.author: Matthias

customer_reviews.title: Has worked great.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this iron for a year and a half, and I have been very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: A+ product for price
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Decent temp control but does not cool down when just sitting in holder.
customer_reviews.author: Eric T Smith

customer_reviews.title: Not bad..
customer_reviews.text: Nice station.. tricky to get the tips to accept solder.. make sure you have some flux. The screen on mine was pushed in, but it works nice. The movement wake feature is pretty cool.
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great soldering station, my only regret is not buying sooner. I've been procrastinating about for a couple of years...
customer_reviews.author: Ferincr

customer_reviews.title: It is now my go-to machine on the bench
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, why haven't I bought a soldering station in all these 30 years of tinkering. Comes up to heat fast, lots of various sizes of tips, replacement heat sensor. The only problem is that the rubber feet come off too easy.
customer_reviews.author: Roger M.

customer_reviews.title: I like their soldering iron's connector better than the Weller
customer_reviews.text: Greta value. I like their soldering iron's connector better than the Weller.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great Iron Gets hot fast and works well every time .

customer_reviews.title: used to get frustrated a lot and end up with ...
customer_reviews.text: used to get frustrated a lot and end up with a mess. THis unit gets the job done first time.
customer_reviews.author: Scott W.

customer_reviews.title: Aouye Soldering Station
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic unit, is exactly what I hoped it would be. Very easy to use, love the digital temperature readout. Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Judy A. Beard

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: great work station. ive done multiple projects with this; it just works and heats to programmed temp QUICK
customer_reviews.author: sebastian

customer_reviews.title: Broke in a few months
customer_reviews.text: Used it for one month before the element broke. Mfr supplies another in the box, but it was too difficult to replace. Ended up buying a new iron. Hope this one lasts longer. Other than that, I like the station. Controls are ipod-simple. No manual necessary. Comes to temp very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Joe VTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Heats up so quick.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first digital iron. It gets to temperature in just a few seconds. I have had no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Davidson

product_meta.title: Aoyue 9378 Pro Series 60 Watt Programmable Digital Soldering Station - ESD Safe, includes 10 tips, C/F switchable, Configurable Iron Holder, Plug-in Spare Heating Element
feature_bullets: Vibration sensor in handle to detect movement
Programmable sleep Function to increase tip life
60 watt iron with over 50 available tip sizes (10 tips included with 1 installed)
2 quick temperature programmable presets, Plug-in heater element
Digital thermostat control with switchable °C / °F readout
